page.title: 05DRY-STONE WALLING
page.content: Spitlers Edge is marked by a typical dry-stone wall running from the top of Winter Hill to Redmonds Edge, where it becomes replaced by wooden posts or stumps. These walls are a feature of this moorland area, and divide up the pastures. The stone was quarried locally and abandoned quarries are clearly seen e.g. Adam's Delf and Naylors. Some of the walls are sadly dilapidated, but recently some have been restored by the North West Water Authority. They also have put up a new wooden fence along both sides of the A675 to prevent sheep straying onto this busy main road. The abandoned dwellings are usually surrounded by walls, with a few trees such as sycamore remaining to mark the site. The same local stone was used for all these buildings.
